data.title: Truck driver
data.text: Great place great food ambiance is friendly and very clean cool to stay out of the heat.. it's not a huge restaurant but big enough for a family to eat . They also cater..

data.title: great lunch
data.text: Get there early.  It gets crowded, but if you have patience you will eat well.  They have typical Latin fare.  It is very good, not greasy and great rice for sure.

data.title: Small but Mighty
data.text: This little place serves up good stick to your ribs Caribbean food. My favorite is the chicken soup...what flavor! Love the flavors in the other foods pork, chicken etc. The portions are also large so share or plan on leftovers (my preference) The prices are very reasonable so it makes it fun to try new things without breaking the bank.

data.title: Excellent Pork
data.text: This place is a corner shop but with very tasty Spanish food. We love their pork and beans/rice platter along with plantain.

data.title: Caribbean Comfort Food
data.text:
I've driven past the D'William Restaurant at the corner of Goepp and Linden dozens of times.  The outside doesn't look like much and the name doesn't ring of authenticity in Caribbean Cuisine.  My mother always said never judge a book by its cover.  That applies here.  

The Pernil was fall off the bone tender and some of the tastiest pork I have ever tried.  The Cerdo Guisada was rich and flavorful.  The is Dominican home cooking at its best.  I also had tostones, red beans and rice and beef empanadas.  All were what you would expect.  All this with a soft drink set me back $18.
The service was friendly and efficient and the restaurant was very clean.  The portions were enough for both me and my wife and we even had leftovers.

My first opinion was certainly wrong.  Take the time to check out this place with its daily changing menu and enjoy.  You won't be disappointed.
